UZOk3VZf.title: Survey on technology of the smart grid
UZOk3VZf.abstract: The discussion of the paper will focus on the Smart Grid, mainly elaborate the fundamental concept, staple characteristic and the pivotal technology of the Smart Grid. The main method to discuss it is to do the research on the key techniques of the Smart Grid which consist of the advanced measurement system, the advanced power electronic equipments and the access to the renewable energy and the distributed energy, In addition, the paper introduce the development of the domestic and the abroad including the American, European and China. As a result I put forward to the opportunities and challenges that the smart grid will face. I draw the conclusion that the utilization of the renewable energy will absolutely be a hot issue in the future and the smart grid will bring radical changes for human beings' life. © (2013) Trans Tech Publications, Switzerland.

3r35HQX0.title: Study on reinforcement technology of heat-resistant para-aramid paper composite
3r35HQX0.abstract: Although epoxy resin plays the leading role in composite material,its long-time service temperature is below 150 ℃. In order to improve the service temperature and mechanical properties of para-aramid paper composite, study has been done on the advanced composite material using polyimide as reinforced resin. The mechanical properties of para-aramid/polyimide composite vary with different processing technology. While pretreated at 100 ℃ and hot pressed under 20 MPa at 250 ℃,its fracture length reaches the maximum of 8 350 m. Moreover,the results of DSC and TGA analysis show that glass-transition temperature is 275 ℃ and initial decomposition temperature is 550 ℃.

V53GYKHr.title: Study on the Improvement of Stability of Buffalo Milk
V53GYKHr.abstract: The effects of emulsifiers, hydrocolloid and salts on the fat separating rate, centrifugation precipitating rate and viscosity of buffalo milk were investigated. Results showed that the best emulsifiers dosage, the ratio of glycerol monostearate to sugar ester, the dosage of carboxymethylcellulose sodium and sodium citrate were 1.5 ‰, 4:1, 0.2 ‰ and 0.2 ‰, respectively. Under the optimized conditions, the fat separating rate, centrifugation precipitating rate of buffalo milk were obviously decreased and its viscosity was increased. Besides, the achieved buffalo milk had a full-bodied taste.

cBuSsFAZ.title: Modeling of wind farms based on artificial neural networks
cBuSsFAZ.abstract: Wind farm model has a great significance for wind farm and power system operation.In order to overcome the deficiencies of mechanism modeling method,static characteristics were approached by using error back propagation(BP) network model and the discussion results of the neural network modeling principle.And then based on the neural network static model,dynamic real-time simulation model was developed.The data samples were pretreated,trained and tested,which made the network model precise and the weight of each floor determined,and so the simulating properties of the object model could be improved.The feasibility and superiority of intelligent modeling were verified by the collecting data and their comparison with the actual results.

auXwwVtO.abstract: Power quality is getting worse with the extensive application of nonlinear loads, and active power filter technology is the effective way to settle the problem. ZPzUSMbG.title: Study on the migration of the latex binder in filter paper
ZPzUSMbG.abstract: The migration of latex binder in filter paper was studied in this paper. The multi-inhibited system composed of alum and hydrotropic cationic polymer was employed to hinder the migration of the latex binder. Many factors, such as the content of the hydrotropic cationic polymer, pre-drying temperature and drying time could influence the degree of the migration of the latex binder. Furthermore, the degree of the binder migration and the structure of the impregnated filter paper were characterized by the method of SEM and the measurement of the interlaminar shearing strength (ILSS).

FEfm3HsO.title: Study on the improvement on water/oil repellency of the filter papers impregnated by the fluoroacrylate emulsions
FEfm3HsO.abstract: In this paper,the techniques of the core-shell emulsion copolymerization was employed to prepare the functional emulsions with the micro-phase separated structure and low surface tension.Meanwhile,the morphological structure of the micelle can also be designed by adjusting the co-monomer composition,change mode,surfactants type and content etc.Furthermore the chemical structure of the emulsion and the morphological structure of teh micelle were charactrized by the methods of FTIR,~(13)C-NMR and TEM.The results illustrated that the fluoroacrylate was successfully introduced into the main chain of the co-polymers.On the other hand,the relationship between the water absorption of the impregnated filter papters and the factors,such as the monomer type,perfluoro-surfactant content and the type of the monomer dosage,were also studied in the paper.

ChnTtqcQ.title: Effect of carrageenan on the quality of a fruit-flavor jam used for mooncake preparation
ChnTtqcQ.abstract: Effects of carrageenan on the moulding, heat-resisting, oil-holding, water-holding, sensory properties and texture of the mooncake fruit-flavor jam were studied in this paper. The results showed that the optimal carrageenan dosage added to the mooncake fruit -flavor jam and ratio of fruit-flavor jam to red bean paste were 1.5‰ and 3:7, respectively, under which a new mooncake mixed fillings was achieved with good moulding, heat-resisting, oil-holding and anti-aging properties, without cracking and oil leaking in a 3-month storage. At the same time, the mixed filling not only retained the delicate structure of original red bean paste with moderate elasticity, but also reduced the sweetness of the traditional bean paste giving a better taste, which can be prepared and used in Cantonese mooncakes.

nqenXPzB.title: Study on para-aramid paper reinforced by special resin
nqenXPzB.abstract: In order to improve the mechanical properties of the para-aramid paper, various polyimide can by used as reinforcing resin. It is found that the mechanical properties of the para-aramid paper reinforced by polyimide are much better than that by epoxy resin. The PMDA system puts up great mechanical property and leads to the higher breaking length of 5787 m due to its higher molecular weight. On the other hand, the polyimide of ODPA system creates greater mechanical property due to its flexibility of the molecular structure and close contact with the aramid fibers. Its breaking length is as high as 5614 m. Moreover, the mechanical properties of the para-aramid paper reinforced by the resin of lower imide degree are more excellent than that reinforced by the resin of higher imide.

r8KX1AP5.title: The simulation and design for MPPT of PV system based on incremental conductance method
r8KX1AP5.abstract: Completing the design for the model of photovoltaic array and achieving to track the array's maximum power point by the help of Incremental Conductance Method. This article firstly introduces a practical model of photovoltaic cells, by which the photovoltaic array's model is obtained. To achieve the maximum power point tracking the Incremental Conductance method is used. Finally, with the help of embedded MATLAB function the article succeeds to achieve the algorithm. Simulation results show the accuracy of the PV model and the practical value in the algorithm which has better tracking performance and dynamic characteristics. © 2010 IEEE.

qvKozO91.title: Ultimate boundary estimation and topological horseshoe analysis on a parallel 4D hyperchaotic system with any number of attractors and its multi-scroll
qvKozO91.abstract: This paper constructs a new four-dimensional autonomous hyperchaotic system with complex dynamic behaviors, and its boundary is estimated based on the proposed method and the optimization idea. Inspired by the “parallel universe theory,” a trigonometric function is used to do coordinate transformation of the original new system to generate any number of attractors. Simulation results show that there are infinite equilibriums in the transformed system. Compared with the original new system, the transformed system is more sensitive to the initial values. Based on the estimated boundary of the original system, the boundary of transformed system could be obtained. To verify the existence of chaos of the transformed system, the topology horseshoe of the system is investigated. The positive topological entropy of the transformed system verifies the existence of hyperchaos. Furthermore, selecting proper parameter values, the transformed system shows a multi-scroll attractor. Applying multi-variable trigonometric transformation can also induce any number of attractors and multi-scroll phenomenon in multi-dimension, which is an interesting phenomenon.

E7957HLw.title: Grid-connected Repetitive Control and Simulation of Photovoltaic Power Generation System
E7957HLw.abstract: The article makes a further research on the topic of grid-connected photovoltaic.Considering the characteristics of photovoltaic cells and grid requirements,two level topological structure is adopted in the system.In order to realize the maximum power point tracking and the bus voltage regulating,DC/DC inverter is used.The direct current will be converted into alternating current which is sent to the grid by the inverter.Among them,the repetitive control technology is applied to the inverter in order to achieve a precise control to the current.Finally,the simulation is done by using the Matlab.A set of experimental results carried out on a computer are provided to validate the proposed approach.

mcCEpI32.title: Synthesis of lignin-G-MMA and its utilization in PVC/wood composite
mcCEpI32.abstract: Lignin with low molecular weight (LA), fractionated from soda lignin by methanol extraction, was grafted with methyl methacrylate (MMA) and used for interfacial modification for poly (vinyl chloride) (PVC)/wood flour composites. By sequential extraction with chloroform and aqueous NaOH solution, the grafting product was separated into three fractions by the different solubility of various components in these solvents. The data of lignin contents in three fractions indicate that more than 80% of the lignin participated in the copolymerization. The hydrophilic wood surface was transformed into a hydrophobic one by the grafting product treatment. The grafting product exhibited a positive influence on improving the mechanical performances of PVC/wood composites. In comparison with untreated ones, the tensile and impact strengths of composites containing 30 phr of wood flour treated with 2wt% grafting product (MMA/LA =2:1) were increased by 20.9% and 35.3%, respectively. A significant increase in storage modulus (E′) was observed upon the incorporation of treated wood flour. SEM images showed that the dispersion of treated wood flour in the polymer matrix was improved. It can be inferred that the polymer-wood interfacial bonding was strengthened.

H3FdU6SF.title: Application of bifurcation theory to voltage stability in power system
H3FdU6SF.abstract: In order to study on the problem of voltage stability of power system, this paper describes the static bifurcation analysis and the dynamic bifurcation analysis in voltage stabilization analysis of power system and its relationship with the voltage stability,discusses the voltage instability caused by two main bifurcation formal definition, the occurrence of the conditions and the calculation of the bifurcation point, and points out advantages and disadvantages of various algorithms. Finally the paper looks forward to further study of the bifurcation theory in terms of voltage stability. © (2013) Trans Tech Publications, Switzerland.

JOfDQWg3.title: Study on nonlinear SVC control for improving power system stability
JOfDQWg3.abstract: A nonlinear voltage controller is designed for static Var compensator (SVC) by using the direct feedback linearization (DFL) theory. It is pointed out that the SVC with only voltage control is able to maintain the voltage only at its location but can not produce additional damping torque to the system. By improvement of the nonlinear SVC voltage controller, a signal modulation type synthetical nonlinear SVC controller has been developed. It is able to produce additional damping torque and maintain the voltage at SVC location. The digital simulation results support the analysis of the paper.

YVnlZOl1.title: A linear auto disturbance rejection controller for shunt hybrid active power filters and its stability analysis
YVnlZOl1.abstract: A first-order mathematical model suitable for shunt hybrid active power filters (SHAPF) applied in medium-and high-voltage power systems is built, and based on its state space model a linear extension state observer (LESO) for state observation and disturbance estimation and the error feedback control law are designed, and considering the slow response of the object with its own time-delay the tracking differentiator link is got rid of and then a first-order linear auto disturbance rejection controller (LADRC) for current tracking is established. The stability of SHAPF with first-order LADRC is analyzed by Lyapunov stability analysis and analysis result shows that the control system is asymptotically stable and is stable in engineering practice. Applying the proposed first-order LADRC to current tracking link of SHAPF in a certain 10kV transmission line to perform the simulation, simulation results show that the LADRC can cope with the contradiction between overshooting and rapidity effectively, and the performance of the LADRC is better than that of traditional PI controller, thus the effectiveness of linear auto disturbance rejection control strategy is verified.

zghEVXZB.title: The LADRC control system of distribution static synchronous compensator based on chaotic sequences PFPWM
zghEVXZB.abstract: The fast response of the distribution static synchronous compensator (DSTATCOM) makes it efficient solution for improving power quality in distribution systems. In view of difficulty in random signal selection and realization of random frequency pulse width modulation (RFPWM) being used to DSTATCOM, This article put forward a kind of new RFPWM based on Chebychev chaotic sequence. At the same time, extended states observer (ESO) in LADRC can provide the estimate of the real action of the system internal (including the unmeasured and coupled state) and external unknown disturbances, and thus it realized d, q axis current decoupling of linear active disturbance rejection control. Finally a new control system was formed based on chaotic modulation and LADRC. The simulation results showed that the new system not only decreased harmonic amplitude but professed better rapidity and robustness. © 2012 American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
